channel.title: Gamefly question
channel.description:
If I signup for the Gamefly free trial will they charge me?
We may offer free trials, trial memberships, and discount introductory offers of the Service to allow customers to become familiar with the many benefits of the subscription plans we offer. These trials and introductory offers are available to new (first-time) customers only, limited to one per household, and cannot be combined with any other offer. These limited trials and introductory offers are only valid in the 50 United States and the District of Columbia. A valid credit card is required. WE AUTHORIZE THE CARD UP TO THE AMOUNT OF ONE MONTHLY FEE IN ORDER TO VERIFY THE ACCOUNT. We receive no money from this transaction, even if your bank or credit card company temporarily holds the funds in your account. We will begin billing your credit card for a monthly subscription fee (plus any applicable taxes) on the first day following the end of your trial or introductory offer period. YOU MUST CANCEL YOUR SUBSCRIPTION PRIOR TO THE END OF YOUR TRIAL OR INTRODUCTORY OFFER PERIOD TO AVOID HAVING YOUR CREDIT CARD CHARGED. During a free trial or trial membership period, customers will not be eligible to receive free shipping on used game purchases and will not accrue GameFly Rewards.

item.title: Gamefly question
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Andrew Ferguson:

Even if you do get charged its worth it for trying out games.

True, I try out games I would never think to playing and some actually impress. I tried Elder Scrolls for the first time and realized I was no-lifing for the entire week.

Read full topic

item.title: Gamefly question
item.dc:creator: @Mack_n_cheese Mack n cheese
item.description:
@Mack_n_cheese wrote:

they ask for credit card info and everything so after the first month they can start charging you. you have to cancel before than (:

Read full topic

item.title: Gamefly question
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Even if you do get charged its worth it for trying out games.

Read full topic

item.title: Gamefly question
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

It goes like this;

1.) You sign up for free trial - You a need credit card to sign up
2.) Month is over - You can cancel at any time.
3.) If you don’t cancel you will be charged the monthly fee until you do effectively making you a member.

Read full topic

item.title: Gamefly question
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

They don’t charge you if you cancel before the free trial is over, once its the day over the trial period they start charging.

Read full topic

item.title: Gamefly question
item.dc:creator: @Immortal_Technique Immortal Technique
item.description:
@Immortal_Technique wrote:

[quote=“Jamie1200, post:2, topic:397803”][quote author=Immortal Technique link=topic=494935.msg3618523#msg3618523 date=1307199976]
If I signup for the Gamefly free trial will they charge me?
[/quote]

Answered your own question.
If i sign up for a gamefly FREE TRAIL. will they CHARGE me.[/quote]

I read something in the Terms of use about they will charge me one monthly fee to verify im a real member

Read full topic
